Operation 'FetchAuthorize' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description is overly terse and lacks critical OAuth context. Improved version explains the operation's role in OAuth flow, clarifies input parameters (client_id, redirect_uri, scope, state), describes the output (authorization URI), and explains the subsequent redirect behavior. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve OAuth authorization URI for user consent
data.description_suggestion: Generates an OAuth authorization URI that redirects users to the Twilio authorization endpoint for granting permissions. This is the first step in the OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow. Accepts parameters including client_id, redirect_uri, scope, and state. Returns the authorization URI that should be presented to the user for authentication and consent. The user will be redirected to the provided redirect_uri with an authorization code upon approval.
data.reasoning: Original description is overly terse and lacks critical OAuth context. Improved version explains the operation's role in OAuth flow, clarifies input parameters (client_id, redirect_uri, scope, state), describes the output (authorization URI), and explains the subsequent redirect behavior. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'CreateToken' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description conflates the grant exchange mechanism with token types. Improved version clarifies the two supported grant types, specifies required request parameters, explains each returned token type and their purposes, and provides guidance on token usage. This enables AI agents to understand the token exchange flow and how to use returned credentials for subsequent API calls.

data.current_summary: Issues a new Access token (optionally identity_token & refresh_token) in exchange of Oauth grant
data.current_description: Issues a new Access token (optionally identity_token & refresh_token) in exchange of Oauth grant
data.summary_suggestion: Exchange OAuth grant for access and refresh tokens
data.description_suggestion: Exchanges an OAuth authorization code or refresh token for access tokens. Accepts grant_type (authorization_code or refresh_token), code or refresh_token, client_id, and client_secret in the request body. Returns an access token for API authentication, and optionally an identity_token (for OpenID Connect) and refresh_token (for obtaining new access tokens without user re-authentication). The access token is valid for a limited time period. Use the returned access token in subsequent API requests via the Authorization header.
data.reasoning: Original description conflates the grant exchange mechanism with token types. Improved version clarifies the two supported grant types, specifies required request parameters, explains each returned token type and their purposes, and provides guidance on token usage. This enables AI agents to understand the token exchange flow and how to use returned credentials for subsequent API calls.
